intro: Myosotis patavi, commonly known as the Alpine forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is often found in mountainous environments. Myosotis patavi is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is known for its delicate appearance and ecological significance in alpine ecosystems.
